body:
I tested the current master, and when I used the QT client, then a lot of RPC calls returned errors with "JSON double out of range". This wasn't the case, when using bitcoind however, at least for me.

It turns out this seems to be another locale related issue: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7e98a3c642222edc0813ced945d4b6e548cb8ca8 added [ParseDouble()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/7e98a3c642222edc0813ced945d4b6e548cb8ca8/src/utilstrencodings.cpp#L461), which uses `strtod`.

`strtod` is locale dependent, and with a locale, where the decial point isn't `.`, the resulting numbers are unexpected, and `ParseDouble()` fails, due to it's check, whether there are [trailing characters](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/7e98a3c642222edc0813ced945d4b6e548cb8ca8/src/utilstrencodings.cpp#L471) left.

When using QT, then it looks like `LC_NUMERIC` (and friends) are based on the user's locale, while bitcoind appears to use the `"C"` locale for all `LC_xxxx`.

The configuration option `"-lang"` seems to have no effect here.
title: ParseDouble() is faulty, depending on locale
